issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While investigating euca-2991, I created a test that :

  1. launch a m1.small every 4 seconds 
  2. wait for instance to becoming "running state"
  3. Terminate the instance
  4. Wait for the terminated instance to be destroyed.
  5. Examines output of tgtadm to see if any lingering iSCSi devices are left. 

After  about 5 hours ( approximately 50 runs ) the system ends up with incorrect availability statistics after instances have been destroyed:
 
{noformat}

[root@b-15 ~]# euca-describe-availability-zones verbose
AVAILABILITYZONE	cluster01	10.101.1.15 arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- vm types	free / max   cpu   ram  disk
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- m1.small	0003 / 0004   1    512     5
AVAILABILITYZONE	|- c1.medium	0001 / 0002   2    512    10

{noformat}

Note:  the free m1.small should be:  4.
       the free c1.medium should be: 2.

This behavior is repeatable .

No lingering kvm instances on NC .
fields.summary: Repeating launching and terminating EBS images leaves availability counts incorrect

comments.body: John, please provide info from the logs.

These log shows the failure of instance 
i-DF9E3F0A

1.  It appears the instance never appears on the NC to run - According to the 
   cc.log , when the terminate request is received .. the cc does nothing because because it has no knowledge of the instance. 
2.  Once a instance fails to run (stays in PENDING), the available resource (cpu used/free) is never incremented after the termination.
3. com.eucalyptus.vm.VmRuntimeState.handleStateTransition() . one point where a Instance is torn down:
{noformat}
INFO [VmRuntimeState:VmControl.16] [com.eucalyptus.vm.VmRuntimeState.handleStateTransition(VmRuntimeState.java):192] i-99463F94 state change: PENDING -> SHUTTING_DOWN (previously PENDING)



{noformat}

this seems to be the area the failure occurs:

{noformat}


Wed Jan 30 15:47:46 2013 DEBUG [Cluster:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Futures.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#490] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.clearExceptions(Cluster.java):612] ServiceConfiguration cluster arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/ 10.101.1.15:8774:/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC:host-local:ENABLED: no pending errors to clear.

       at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)


Caused by: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received.:StartNetworkType:2b73293f-6b11-4aac-ae15-cb1af08f0fe7:return=true:epoch=18:status=null
        ... 105 more
Wed Jan 30 15:49:12 2013 DEBUG [Cluster:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Callbacks:class com.eucalyptus.util.async.Callbacks$BasicCallbackProcessor.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#500] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster$ServiceStateCallback.fire(Cluster.java):300] DescribeServices for arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/


{noformat}

I can 
see the describeAvailableZones is not being sent to the CC to get fresh 
information after a bfebs has failed. 

The CC and the NC both report available resources as : cores: 4/4 

Setting a breakpoint in :

DescribeAvailabilityZonesResponseType()

the counts are reported as : m1.small : 3/4 .

{noformat}

Sequence of events: 
 1. Instance runs. 
 2. RESERVE Resource:  TOKEN_RESERVED: ResourceToken:i-1F5F42CA:
 3. Timeout - ExecutionException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received.:StartNetworkType.

  The resource is never REDEEMED .

 On successful launch, TOKEN order:

TOKEN_RESERVED: ResourceToken:i-98A74310:
 TOKEN_SUBMITTED: ResourceToken:i-98A74310:10.101.50.22:tag=3261:idx=10
 TOKEN_REDEEMED: ResourceToken:i-98A74310:10.101.50.22:tag=3261:idx=10

{noformat}

Ok.  So... this one looks complicated:  It is not clear to me that there is a bug in the {{ClusterAllocator}} code, but rather a corner case in {{ResourceToken.abort()}} (or maybe {{Allocation.abort()}}.  From what I can tell the failures which are happening are all interleaved with CC errors happening during describe operations.

First things first, we should determine whether the cluster state is playing a role.  To do that we need to ensure we are looking at the right instance:
[~jdonnelly] Can you reproduce the problem where the resources are misreported and then determine exactly which instance id owns that resource token using the following:
{code}
euca-modify-property -p euca='com.eucalyptus.cluster.Clusters.getInstance().listValues().collect{ "\n" + it.@nodeState }'
{code}
When you manage to reproduce it can you save all the log files so we can try the forensics again?

More specifically, looking at what happened to  the instance {{i-DF9E3F0A}} it seems the underlying cause is quite involved (from what I can tell from looking at the logs).  But at the same time, it is hard for me to determine from the logs whether {{i-DF9E3F0A}} is really the right instance id.

We get the run request and see the availability:
{code}
Fri Dec 21 08:00:52 2012  INFO [ClusterAllocator:VmControl.16] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.info(BaseRecord.java):173] :1356105652373:ClusterAllocator:eed3eb44-db65-4261-b72a-935dcabb03ff:arn:aws:euare:987047115995:user/admin:VM_PREPARE:[com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.Allocations$Allocation@480ff8b4 context=Context request=[?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?] ResourceToken:i-DF9E3F0A:10.101.50.6:tag=443:idx=9] reservationIndex=1158 instanceIds=[0:i-DF9E3F0A] expiration=null]
Fri Dec 21 08:00:57 2012 INFO   Availability: cc_01 -> 2
Fri Dec 21 08:00:57 2012 INFO   Availability: cc_01 -> 2
{code}
The run instance gets sent to the CC, during which {{DescribeServicesType}} fails to respond (!!!) causing the CC to become NOTREADY.
{code}
Fri Dec 21 08:01:09 2012  INFO [ClusterAllocator:VmControl.16] [com.eucalyptus.records.BaseRecord.info(BaseRecord.java):173] :1356105669944:ClusterAllocator:98537aec-2df3-4a82-a52e-52c0901e16c6:arn:aws:euare:987047115995:user/admin:VM_PREPARE:[com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.Allocations$Allocation@657cee02 context=Context request=[?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?] ResourceToken:i-C1EA40B0:10.101.50.8:tag=443:idx=12] reservationIndex=1162 instanceIds=[0:i-C1EA40B0] expiration=null]

Fri Dec 21 08:02:21 2012 ERROR   [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] CHECK:null arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/ ENABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [Channel was closed before the response was received.:DescribeServicesType:1285739d-191c-4b77-a50f-05e034b3f33a:return=true:epoch=20:status=null]

Fri Dec 21 08:02:25 2012 ERROR   [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] CHECK:null arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/ NOTREADY->DISABLED=NOTREADY [Channel was closed before the response was received.:DescribeServicesType:1285739d-191c-4b77-a50f-05e034b3f33a:return=true:epoch=20:status=null]

ResourceToken:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Callbacks:class com.eucalyptus.util.async.Callbacks$BasicCallbackProcessor.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#705] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.ResourceToken.abort(ResourceToken.java):185] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot   as unallocating[allocated.false->unallocated.true] when it is unallocated.false: Address 10.101.50.6 AddressTransition unallocating:impending->unallocated(false)
at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ResourceToken.abort(ResourceToken.java:183)      
{code}

After which the availability of resources is reported **correctly**!
{code}
Fri Dec 21 08:07:42 2012 INFO   Availability: cc_01 -> 4

{code}

It looks like this may be happening because of a time out caused by running the SC on the same host.  In the logs there is a correlation between periods of time when the CC is failing to respond to {{DescribeServices}} operations (and so is {{NOTREADY}}) and when multiple volumes are being created at the same time.

{code}
Fri Dec 21 08:02:21 2012 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#14] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] CHECK:null  arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/ ENABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [Channel was closed before the response was received.:DescribeServicesType:1285739d-191c-4b77-a50f-05e034b3f33a:return=true:epoch=20:status=null]

Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#191] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):287] Finished executing: losetup /dev/loop0 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-DBD93D85
Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#191] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):288] Result of: losetup /dev/loop0 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-DBD93D85 stdout: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#191] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):289] Result of: losetup/dev/loop0 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-DBD93D85 return value: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#174] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):287] Finished executing: losetup /dev/loop1 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-A8E63CFA
Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#174] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):288] Result of: losetup /dev/loop1 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-A8E63CFA stdout: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:23 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#174] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):289] Result of: losetup/dev/loop1 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-A8E63CFA return value: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:24 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#181] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):287] Finished executing: losetup /dev/loop2 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-EE183ED3
Fri Dec 21 08:02:24 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#181] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):288] Result of: losetup /dev/loop2 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-EE183ED3 stdout: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:24 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#181] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):289] Result of: losetup/dev/loop2 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-EE183ED3 return value: 
Fri Dec 21 08:02:25 2012 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#50] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] CHECK:null  arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/ NOTREADY->DISABLED=NOTREADY [Channel was closed before the response was received.:DescribeServicesType:1285739d-191c-4b77-a50f-05e034b3f33a:return=true:epoch=20:status=null]
{code}

We can correlate this with the CC not being ENABLED anymore by the following logline in the {{cc.log}} which is only printed at {{cluster/handlers-state.c:clean_network_state():834}}.
{code}
2012-12-21 08:02:32 DEBUG 000019988 safekillfile             | calling safekill with pid 31231
{code}


The timeline that may be causing the problem looks something like this:
t0. RunInstance arrives at CLC and allocates a resource token for i-DF9E3F0A.
t1. ClusterAllocator is created and user recieves response to RunInstance request for i-DF9E3F0A.
  - note:  This is the time at which the ServiceConfiguration for the Cluster is looked up (in com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.SubmitAllocation.apply(Allocation))
  - This means the cluster is still ENABLED at this time.
t2. ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A sends create volume messages to SC (which is still idle at this time)
t3. ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A waits for volumes to be created
t4. Volume is created and ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A sends AttachStorageVolume to SC
t5. ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A submits the RunInstances operation to the CC and waits for a response
t6. Some error occurs in polling the Cluster causing it to go to NOTREADY.
t7. ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A gets an error back from RunInstances operation.
t8. ClusterAllocator:i-DF9E3F0A fails to perform abort()

Before going down this path we really need to verify which instance id is the right one to be chasing as the causal trace.

Two more traces of instances :
   i-F6B9453D 
   i-D8F4403E

That never ran and leaves accounting incorrect.

For each instance .. This appears to be what is happening:
 
The cluster is still ENABLED at this time.

t1. ClusterAllocator:i-D8F4403E sends StartNetworkType
t2. StartNetworkType()  times out .. throws 

 {noformat}
ExecutionException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.ConnectionException: Channel was closed before the response was received
 {noformat}

 
t3. I do not see any trace code indicating ClusterAllocator:i-D8F4403E performs any abort() .. nor hit breakpoints .

A similar failure yields:

{noformat}
Tue Feb  5 14:44:29 PST 2013: i-92AF445A is running
Tue Feb  5 14:44:29 PST 2013: i-C1EC4751 is running
Tue Feb  5 14:44:30 PST 2013: i-388C4407 is running
Tue Feb  5 14:48:53 PST 2013; i-F70B45DE Never ran
Tue Feb  5 14:48:54 PST 2013; Runs: 3, cores=1/4, Instances: 4
Tue Feb  5 14:52:25 PST 2013, Remaining iSCSI tgt:0
Tue Feb  5 14:52:26 PST 2013; small: 0003, med: 0001
Tue Feb  5 14:52:26 PST 2013; we lost a entry 0004, 0003
[root@b-15 ~]# euca-modify-property -p euca='com.eucalyptus.cluster.Clusters.getInstance().listValues().collect{ "\n" + it.@nodeState }'
PROPERTY	euca	[
ClusterNodeState pending=[ResourceToken:i-F70B45DE:10.101.50.20:tag=362:idx=11] redeemed=[] submitted=[]] was executed successfully.
[root@b-15 ~]# [root@b-15 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
[root@b-15 ~]# 


{noformat}

{noformat}

[root@b-15 ~]# euca-modify-property -p euca='com.eucalyptus.cluster.Clusters.getInstance().listValues().collect{ "\n" + it.@nodeState }'
PROPERTY	euca	[
ClusterNodeState pending=[ResourceToken:i-CD713FF9:10.101.50.20:tag=2660:idx=12] redeemed=[] submitted=[]] was executed successfully.


 The exception never gets passed up to the caller - the run state stays PENDING:


1. The VMSTATE  is set to ABORT :

     ERROR [StatefulMessageSet:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#177] [com.eucalyptus.util.async.StatefulMessageSet.run(StatefulMessageSet.java):239] :1360898583226:StatefulMessageSet:VM_START_ABORTED:

2. Yet the run indication stays as PENDING:

cloud-error.log:2133:Thu Feb 14 19:21:53 2013 ERROR [ClusterAllocator:Eucalyptus.cluster:ClusterConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc_01/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#177] [com.eucalyptus.cloud.run.ClusterAllocator.<init>(ClusterAllocator.java):223] jpd6 sent setupMessages: i-CD713FF9 State: PENDING

{noformat}
